title: Creating input data for independent contrast regressions
text: InNOutBT CRAN yet can install latest development version GitHub:
code: #install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("DBOSlab/InNOutBT") library(InNOutBT)

what: Example of spreadsheet with georeferenced data and associated traits
title: Creating input data for independent contrast regressions
text: using BayesTraits.inputs, make sure spreadsheet georeferenced data associated traits also includes terminal column accession/sample linked corresponding tip label input phylogenetic tree.

what: Create sample of trait data using a subset of explanatory variables
title: Creating input data for independent contrast regressions
text: example creates linked mean data files “DBH” defined response variable whereas “bio12” “bio15” explanatory variables. words, first name argument traitcols define response variable.
code: library(InNOutBT) library(treeio)  traitdata <- read.csv("Data/vataireoids_1610_25May2022_BayesTraits.csv") phylo <- read.beast("Data/vatcomb30_24May22_Yule.con.tree")  BayesTraits.inputs(tree = phylo,                    data = traitdata,                    tipscol = "terminal",                    traitcols = c("DBH", "bio12", "bio15"),                    dir_create = "results_BayesTraits_input",                    fileDistData = "BayesTraits_linked_data_bio12_bio15.txt",                    fileMeanData = "BayesTraits_mean_data_bio12_bio15.txt")

what: Log transform any variable before creating the input linked and mean data
title: Creating input data for independent contrast regressions
text: may want log-10 transform variable running phylogenetic regressions. just need provide argument logtransf variables/traits log-transformed. log-transformed trait always result new column new name additional prefix “log10” added following: “log10NAMEOFTHETRAIT”. name(s) log-transformed trait(s) used analyses listed argument addtraits. Note example variable “DBH” chosen log-transformed also response variable. case, need reorder variables argument ordtraits make sure newly generated “log10DBH” variable remain front, .e. response variable. may also want save original spreadsheet including new column log-transformed DBH giving name argument fileOrigData.
code: BayesTraits.inputs(tree = phylo,                    data = traitdata,                    tipscol = "terminal",                    logtransf = "DBH",                    traitcols = c("bio12", "bio15"),                    addtraits = "log10DBH",                    ordtraits = c("log10DBH", "bio12", "bio15"),                    dir_create = "results_BayesTraits_input",                    fileDistData = "BayesTraits_linked_data_bio12_bio15.txt",                    fileMeanData = "BayesTraits_mean_data_bio12_bio15.txt",                    fileOrigData = "vataireoids_1610_25May2022_BayesTraits_DBH_logtransf.csv")

what: Create sample of trait data using a different subset of explanatory variables
title: Creating input data for independent contrast regressions
text: setting argument NodeCount = TRUE, function calculate net node count species/accession given phylogenetic tree reference. Net node successfully used explore effect speciation rates (e.g. O’Donovan et al. 2018) response variable. See example also chosen log10-transform response variable “DBH” newly created column net node, listed arguments addtraits ordtraits.
code: BayesTraits.inputs(tree = phylo,                    data = traitdata,                    tipscol = "terminal",                    NodeCount = TRUE,                    logtransf = c("DBH", "NodeCount"),                    traitcols = c("bio12", "bio15"),                    addtraits = c("log10NodeCount", "log10DBH"),                    ordtraits = c("log10DBH", "bio12", "bio15", "log10NodeCount"),                    dir_create = "results_BayesTraits_input",                    fileDistData = "BayesTraits_linked_data_bio12_bio15_nnodes.txt",                    fileMeanData = "BayesTraits_mean_data_bio12_bio15_nnodes.txt",                    fileOrigData = "vataireoids_1610_25May2022_BayesTraits_netnodes_logtransf.csv")

what: Create sample of trait data using quadratic net nodes as the explanatory variable
title: Creating input data for independent contrast regressions
text: may want square transform variable running phylogenetic regressions. just need provide argument sqrtransf variables/traits squared. square-transformed trait always result new column new name additional prefix “sqr” added following: “sqrNAMEOFTHETRAIT”. name(s) square-transformed trait(s) used analyses listed argument addtraits. Note example newly created variable “NodeCount” chosen log- square-transformed.
code: BayesTraits.inputs(tree = phylo,                    data = traitdata,                    tips_colname = "terminal",                    NodeCount = TRUE,                    logtransf = c("DBH", "NodeCount"),                    sqrtransf = c("NodeCount"),                    addtraits = c("sqrNodeCount", "log10DBH"),                    ordtraits = c("log10DBH", "log10NodeCount", "sqrNodeCount"),                    dir_create = "results_BayesTraits_input",                    fileDistData = "BayesTraits_linked_data_nnodes_nnodes2.txt",                    fileMeanData = "BayesTraits_mean_data_nnodes_nnodes2.txt",                    fileOrigData = "vataireoids_1610_25May2022_BayesTraits_netnodes_logtransf_sqrtransf.csv")

what: Create sample of trait data for GEO model
title: Creating input data for independent contrast regressions
text: example shows can also define columns “longitude” “latitude” original spreadsheet create input linked mean data geographic-model-based phylogenetic regression. See also associated article create shell script) BayesTraits.shell multiple phylogenetic regression analyses, well another article use BayesTraits.outputs process resulting output files) analyses.
code: BayesTraits.inputs(tree = phylo,                    data = traitdata,                    tips_colname = "terminal",                    NodeCount = FALSE,                    traitcols = c("longitude", "latitude"),                    dir_create = "results_BayesTraits_input",                    fileDistData = "BayesTraits_linked_data_GEO.txt",                    fileMeanData = "BayesTraits_mean_data_GEO.txt")

title: Processing output data from independent contrast regressions
text: InNOutBT CRAN yet can install latest development version GitHub:
code: #install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("DBOSlab/InNOutBT") library(InNOutBT)

what: Processing Log and Stone output files
title: Processing output data from independent contrast regressions
text: function BayesTraits.outputs reads processes Log Stones .txt output files resulting phylogenetic regressions automatically generates tables either Word CSV formats summarizing model, including comparison Bayes Factor. Heatmaps based pairwise Bayes Factor comparison also automatically produced PDF format. Heatmap including Bayes Factor pairwise comparison. Heatmap clustering models based Bayes Factor values. Table describing models coefficients. See also associated article automatically create input files) BayesTraits.inputs phylogenetic regression analyses, well another article create shell script) BayesTraits.shell one --multiple analyses.
code: library(InNOutBT)  BayesTraits.outputs(logst_dir = paste0(getwd(),"/BayesTraits_outputs_log_stone"),                     responvar = "DBH",                     explanvar = c("bio12", "bio15", "nnodes"),                     treetransf = c("Kappa", "Delta", "Lambda", "OU"),                     bayesfactor = TRUE,                     unirates = FALSE,                     outformat = c("Word", "CSV"),                     tableleg = "Phylogenetic regression in BayesTraits: models and coefficients.",                     dir_create = "results_BayesTraits_output",                     outfile = "BayesTraits_output_table",                     height = 12,                     width = 15)

title: Shell scripts for independent contrast regressions
text: InNOutBT CRAN yet can install latest development version GitHub:
code: #install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("DBOSlab/InNOutBT") library(InNOutBT)

title: Shell scripts for independent contrast regressions
text: Set argument syst = "unix" create shell script running phylogenetic regressions macOS Monterey. Note give name response variable analysis argument responvar. Also, use argument treetransf define (listed vector) available tree transformation models want run phylogenetic regressions input data. , choose among models Kappa, Delta, Lambda, OU (Ornstein–Uhlenbeck), UNI (used uniform tree transformation), VR (used variable rates) Fabric (want use general statistical mode accommodates uneven evolutionary landscape described Pagel et al. (2022).
code: library(InNOutBT)  BayesTraits.shell(meanfile_dir = "results_BayesTraits_input/09Jun2022",                   linkfile_dir = "results_BayesTraits_input/09Jun2022",                   treefile_dir = "Data",                   BayesTraits_dir = "/Users/domingoscardoso/BayesTraitsV4",                   responvar = "DBH",                   treetransf = c("UNI", "Lambda", "VR", "Fabric"),                   bi = "30000000",                   it = "130000000",                   sa = "100000",                   st = c("500", "50000"),                   syst = "unix",                   dir_create = "results_BayesTraits_shell",                   cc_DataTree = TRUE)

title: Shell scripts for independent contrast regressions
text: Set argument syst = "windows" create PowerShell script running phylogenetic regressions Windows. function generates running BayesTraits commands multiple regressions, depending parameters set arguments treetransf, bi, , sa, st. Note set argument cc_DataTree = TRUE, tree, mean linked data files also copied directly BayesTraits folder. See also associated article automatically create input files) BayesTraits.inputs phylogenetic regression analyses, well another article use BayesTraits.outputs process resulting output files) analyses.
code: BayesTraits.shell(meanfile_dir = "results_BayesTraits_input/09Jun2022",                   linkfile_dir = "results_BayesTraits_input/09Jun2022",                   treefile_dir = "Data",                   BayesTraits_dir = "/Users/domingoscardoso/BayesTraitsV4",                   responvar = "DBH",                   treetransf = c("UNI", "Lambda", "VR", "Fabric"),                   bi = "30000000",                   it = "130000000",                   sa = "100000",                   st = c("500", "50000"),                   syst = "windows",                   dir_create = "results_BayesTraits_shell",                   cc_DataTree = TRUE)

what: An R package for creating input data to and processing output data from BayesTraits analyses
title: An R package for creating input data to and processing output data from BayesTraits analyses
text: R package creating input data processing output data Meade & Pagel’s (2022) BayesTraits computer package.

title: An R package for creating input data to and processing output data from BayesTraits analyses
text: package InNOutBT still development. Currently, three major functions help automatize BayesTraits phylogenetic independent contrast regression analyses. better understand functions work, see BayesTraits V4.0.0 Manual details specific format input files required BayesTraits, well resulting output files.

title: An R package for creating input data to and processing output data from BayesTraits analyses
text: can install development version InNOutBT GitHub :
code: #install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("DBOSlab/InNOutBT") library(InNOutBT)

title: An R package for creating input data to and processing output data from BayesTraits analyses
text: general description three available functions (BayesTraits.inputs, BayesTraits.shell, BayesTraits.outputs) provided .

what: 1. BayesTraits.inputs: Creating input linked and mean data for phylogenetic regression analyses
title: An R package for creating input data to and processing output data from BayesTraits analyses
text: function produces BayesTraits input data linked samples trait/climate data (distribution data), automatically generating two .txt files: one including linked traits mean values included trait. function also includes argument calculate net node count species/accession given phylogenetic tree reference, successfully used explore effect speciation rates (e.g. O’Donovan et al. 2018) response variable.

previous_headings: Usage > 1. BayesTraits.inputs: Creating input linked and mean data for phylogenetic regression analyses
title: An R package for creating input data to and processing output data from BayesTraits analyses
code: library(InNOutBT) library(treeio)  traitdata <- read.csv("Data/vataireoids_1610_25May2022_BayesTraits.csv") phylo <- read.beast("Data/vatcomb30_24May22_Yule.con.tree")  BayesTraits.inputs(tree = phylo,                    data = traitdata,                    tipscol = "terminal",                    NodeCount = TRUE,                    logtransf = c("DBH", "NodeCount"),                    traitcols = c("bio12", "bio15"),                    addtraits = c("log10NodeCount", "log10DBH"),                    ordtraits = c("log10DBH", "bio12", "bio15", "log10NodeCount"),                    dir_create = "results_BayesTraits_input",                    fileDistData = "BayesTraits_linked_data_bio12_bio15_nnodes.txt",                    fileMeanData = "BayesTraits_mean_data_bio12_bio15_nnodes.txt",                    fileOrigData = "vataireoids_1610_25May2022_BayesTraits_netnodes_logtransf.csv")

what: 2. BayesTraits.shell: Creating shell script for running phylogenetic regression analyses
title: An R package for creating input data to and processing output data from BayesTraits analyses
text: Based directory paths tree, linked mean data input files, function automatically produces shell scripts Unix Windows PowerShell formats running one multiple phylogenetic regression analyses. addition generate shell script directly BayesTraits directory, function also creates running files BayesTraits specified parameters (bi, , sa, st) run, depending chosen model tree transformation.

previous_headings: Usage > 2. BayesTraits.shell: Creating shell script for running phylogenetic regression analyses
title: An R package for creating input data to and processing output data from BayesTraits analyses
code: library(InNOutBT)  BayesTraits.shell(meanfile_dir = "results_BayesTraits_input/03Jun2022",                   linkfile_dir = "results_BayesTraits_input/03Jun2022",                   treefile_dir = "Data",                   BayesTraits_dir = "/Users/domingoscardoso/BayesTraitsV4",                   responvar = "DBH",                   treetransf = c("UNI", "Lambda", "VR"),                   bi = "30000000",                   it = "130000000",                   sa = "100000",                   st = c("500", "50000"),                   syst = "unix",                   dir_create = "results_BayesTraits_shell",                   cc_DataTree = TRUE)

what: 3. BayesTraits.outputs: Processing output data from phylogenetic regression analyses
title: An R package for creating input data to and processing output data from BayesTraits analyses
text: function processes output Log Stones .txt files phylogenetic regression analyses. resulting processed files tables either Word CSV formats summarizing model, including comparison Bayes Factor. Heatmaps based pairwise Bayes Factor comparison also automatically produced PDF format.

previous_headings: Usage > 3. BayesTraits.outputs: Processing output data from phylogenetic regression analyses
title: An R package for creating input data to and processing output data from BayesTraits analyses
code: library(InNOutBT)  BayesTraits.outputs(logst_dir = paste0(getwd(),"/BayesTraits_outputs_log_stone"),                     responvar = "DBH",                     explanvar = c("bio12", "bio15", "nnodes", "nnodes2"),                     treetransf = c("Kappa", "Delta", "Lambda", "OU"),                     bayesfactor = TRUE,                     unirates = FALSE,                     outformat = c("Word", "CSV"),                     tableleg = "Phylogenetic regression in BayesTraits: models and coefficients.",                     dir_create = "results_BayesTraits_output",                     outfile = "BayesTraits_output_table",                     height = 17,                     width = 20)

title: An R package for creating input data to and processing output data from BayesTraits analyses
text: detailed description InNOutBT’s full functionality available .

title: An R package for creating input data to and processing output data from BayesTraits analyses
text: Cardoso, D. & Lavin, M. (2022). InNOutBT: R package creating input data processing output data BayesTraits analyses. https://github.com/dboslab/InNOutBT

what: Produces BayesTraits linked input data — BayesTraits.inputs
title: Produces BayesTraits linked input data — BayesTraits.inputs
text: produces BayesTraits input data linked samples trait/climate data (distribution data) phylogenetic regression analyses Meade & Pagel's (2022) BayesTraits computer package. function automatically generate two .txt files: one including linked traits mean values included trait. function also includes argument calculate net node count species/accession given phylogenetic tree reference, successfully used explore effect speciation rates (e.g. O’Donovan et al. 2018) response variable. See BayesTraits V4.0.0 Manual details specific format input files required BayesTraits.

title: Produces BayesTraits linked input data — BayesTraits.inputs
code: BayesTraits.inputs(tree,                    data,                    tipscol = NULL,                    NodeCount = FALSE,                    logtransf = NULL,                    sqrtransf = NULL,                    traitcols = NULL,                    addtraits = NULL,                    ordtraits = NULL,                    dir_create = "results_BayesTraits_input",                    fileDistData = "BayesTraits_linked_input.txt",                    fileMeanData = "BayesTraits_mean_input.txt",                    fileOrigData = NULL)

title: Produces BayesTraits linked input data — BayesTraits.inputs
text: tree input tree file. can either Newick-formatted tree imported ape's function read.tree treedata-formatted phylogeny generated BEAST read treeio's function read.beast. data input sample trait (distribution) data data.frame format. column must included links accession/record corresponding sample trait data terminal branch label input phylogeny. tipscol Give name column terminals/tip labels within input distribution trait data. NodeCount Logical, default FALSE. function create new column NodeCount input trait data place just left column longitude. net node count species (replicated accession within species) derives input tree. logtransf vector name column(s) trait data log10-transformed. example, define columns c("DBH", "NodeCount") log10-transformed, function automatically create new columns log10DBH logNodeCount log10-transformed DBH NodeCount columns original input data. sqrtransf vector name column(s) trait data square log10-transformed. example, define column Nodecount transformed, function automatically create new column sqrNodeCount NodeCount column original input data. trait included analysis, list argument addtraits (see ). traitcols vector name column(s) input sample trait data serve response/dependent variable (first column name) explanatory/independent variable(s) (second possibly third fourth column) phylogenetic regression analysis BayesTraits. addtraits vector name additional column(s) originally input trait data want generate inputs linked samples trait data mean data BayesTraits analysis. example, chosen NodeCount=TRUE defined new columns log10-transformed square-transformed, listed additional columns included linked sample trait data. ordtraits vector listing order trait names used BayesTraits analysis. ensures first trait column serve response variable, subsequent trait columns serve explanatory variables. Maintain consistent order names associated explanatory variables interpret BayesTraits log output file Beta1, Beta2, etc. reported. Coefficient estimates reported Beta1 can associated first explanatory variable listed, . dir_create Pathway computer's directory file saved. default setting creates directory named results_BayesTraits_input results saved within subfolder directory named current date. fileDistData Name resulting .txt file linked samples trait data. name given, default setting creates file named BayesTraits_linked_input.txt. fileMeanData Name resulting .txt file mean trait data. name given, default setting creates file named BayesTraits_mean_input.txt. fileOrigData define name , originally imported trait data saved CSV file, including newly generated data columns. trait data written disk within directory set argument dir_create, outside current date subfolder.

title: Produces BayesTraits linked input data — BayesTraits.inputs
text: Domingos Cardoso & Matt Lavin

title: Produces BayesTraits linked input data — BayesTraits.inputs
code: if (FALSE) { library(InNOutBT)  ## Loading a example data file data(vatsData)  ## Loading a example tree file data(vatsTree)  BayesTraits.inputs(tree = vatsTree,                    data = vatsData,                    tipscol = "terminal",                    NodeCount = TRUE,                    logtransf = c("DBH", "NodeCount"),                    traitcols = c("bio12", "bio15"),                    addtraits = c("log10NodeCount", "log10DBH"),                    ordtraits = c("log10DBH", "bio12", "bio15", "log10NodeCount"),                    dir_create = "results_BayesTraits_input",                    fileDistData = "BayesTraits_linked_data_bio12_bio15_nnodes.txt",                    fileMeanData = "BayesTraits_mean_data_bio12_bio15_nnodes.txt",                    fileOrigData = "vataireoids_1610_25May2022_BayesTraits_netnodes_logtransf.csv") }

title: Process BayesTraits output data — BayesTraits.outputs
text: processes output Log Stones .txt files phylogenetic regression analyses Meade & Pagel's (2022) BayesTraits computer package. resulting processed files tables either Word CSV formats summarizing model, including comparison Bayes Factor. Heatmaps based pairwise Bayes Factor comparison also automatically produced PDF format. See BayesTraits V4.0.0 Manual details output files produced BayesTraits better understand processed output files current function BayesTraits.outputs.

title: Process BayesTraits output data — BayesTraits.outputs
code: BayesTraits.outputs(logst_dir = NULL,                     responvar = NULL,                     explanvar = NULL,                     treetransf = c("Kappa", "Delta", "Lambda", "OU"),                     bayesfactor = FALSE,                     unirates = TRUE,                     outformat = c("Word", "CSV"),                     tableleg = "Phylogenetic regression in BayesTraits: models and coefficients.",                     dir_create = "results_BayesTraits_output",                     outfile = "BayesTraits_output_table",                     ...)

title: Process BayesTraits output data — BayesTraits.outputs
text: logst_dir Path folder directory Log stepping stone sampler files BayesTraits phylogenetic independent contrast regression analyses stored. Log file(s) contain model options output. stepping stone sampler files file(s) contain estimated log marginal likelihood additional information stones. Make sure also named explanatory variable(s) separated underscore, well exact name tree transformation set analysis. , name either Kappa, Delta, Lambda, OU (Ornstein–Uhlenbeck), UNI (used uniform tree transformation), VR (used variable rates) Fabric (used general statistical model accommodates uneven evolutionary landscape described Pagel et al. (2022). Thus, Log file(s) name something like _VAR1NAME_VAR2NAME.txt.Log.TREETRANSFORMATIONNAME.txt. See following real examples Log input files: "BayesTraits_mean_data_bio12_bio15.txt.Log.VR" "BayesTraits_mean_data_bio12_bio15_nnodes.txt.Log.Lambda". means first Log file contains two models named "bio12" "bio15" based VR (Variable Rates tree transformation), second Log file contains three models named "bio12", "bio15", "nnodes", based Lambda tree transformation. Likewise, Stones file(s) name something like _VAR1NAME_VAR2NAME.txt.Stones.TREETRANSFORMATIONNAME.txt. See following real examples Stones input files: "BayesTraits_mean_data_bio12_bio15.txt.Stones.VR" "BayesTraits_mean_data_bio12_bio15_nnodes.txt.Stones.Lambda". means first Stones file contains two models named "bio12" "bio15" based VR (Variable Rates tree transformation), second Stones file contains three models named "bio12", "bio15", "nnodes", based Lambda tree transformation. responvar Give name response variable. explanvar Give name(s) explanatory variable(s) exactly also written names Log Stones files processed. treetransf Select available BayesTraits tree transformation evolution (Kappa, Delta, Lambda OU), analysed data. analysed data just Uniform, VR Fabric models make sure defined treetransf = NULL. bayesfactor Logical, FALSE, Bayes Factor pairwise comparisons performed among models. unirates Logical, FALSE, results uniform tree transformation displayed main table. outformat Define either "Word" "CSV", vector c("Word", "CSV") , writing results formats. tableleg legend main table, provided also chosen "Word" argument outformat resulting format. give specific legend , Word-formatted table default legend Phylogenetic regression BayesTraits: models coefficients. dir_create Pathway computer's directory, file(s) saved. default setting creates directory named results_BayesTraits_output results saved within another subfolder named current date. outfile Name main resulting table-formatted files either "Word" "CSV" (formats; .e. depending specified argument outformat) saved directory. name given, default setting creates file named BayesTraits_output_table.docx /BayesTraits_output_table.csv. ... additional parameters passed pdf.

title: Process BayesTraits output data — BayesTraits.outputs
text: Table dataframe also saved disk .csv format.

title: Process BayesTraits output data — BayesTraits.outputs
text: Domingos Cardoso & Matt Lavin

what: Create shell scripts to run BayesTraits phylogenetic regression analyses — BayesTraits.shell
title: Create shell scripts to run BayesTraits phylogenetic regression analyses — BayesTraits.shell
text: Based directory paths tree, linked mean data files, automatically produces shell scripts Unix Windows PowerShell formats running one multiple phylogenetic regression analyses Meade & Pagel's (2022) BayesTraits computer package. addition generate shell script directly BayesTraits directory, function also creates running files BayesTraits specified parameters (bi, , sa, st) run, depending chosen model tree transformation. See BayesTraits V4.0.0 Manual details BayesTraits parameters available phylogenetic regression better understand set arguments current function BayesTraits.shell. might also want look use function BayesTraits.inputs produce automatically linked mean data input files prior using BayesTraits.shell.

title: Create shell scripts to run BayesTraits phylogenetic regression analyses — BayesTraits.shell
code: BayesTraits.shell(meanfile_dir = NULL,                   linkfile_dir = NULL,                   treefile_dir = NULL,                   BayesTraits_dir = NULL,                   responvar = NULL,                   treetransf = NULL,                   bi = "30000000",                   it = "130000000",                   sa = "100000",                   st = c("500", "50000"),                   syst = NULL,                   dir_create = "results_BayesTraits_shell",                   cc_DataTree = TRUE)

title: Create shell scripts to run BayesTraits phylogenetic regression analyses — BayesTraits.shell
text: meanfile_dir Path folder directory mean data file(s) () stored. linkfile_dir Path folder directory linked data file(s) () stored. treefile_dir Path folder directory tree file stored. BayesTraits_dir Path folder directory BayesTraits executable file stored. responvar Give name response variable analysis. treetransf Define (listed vector) available tree transformation models want run BayesTraits phylogenetic independent contrast regression analyses input data. , choose among models Kappa, Delta, Lambda, OU (Ornstein–Uhlenbeck), UNI (used uniform tree transformation), VR (used variable rates) Fabric (want use general statistical mode accommodates uneven evolutionary landscape described Pagel et al. (2022). bi Set number iterations burn MCMC chain . Please give number character, .e. quotes. Set number iterations run chain . Please give number character, .e. quotes. sa Set sample frequency. Please give number character, .e. quotes. st stepping stone sampler estimate marginal likelihood. Set number stones use number iterations use stone . Please give numbers characters, .e. vector numbers quotes. syst Give name response variable. dir_create Pathway computer's working directory, file(s) saved. default setting creates directory named "results_BayesTraits_output" results saved within another subfolder named current date. cc_DataTree Logical, default TRUE, copy tree, mean linked data files made directly BayesTraits folder.

title: Create shell scripts to run BayesTraits phylogenetic regression analyses — BayesTraits.shell
text: Domingos Cardoso & Matt Lavin

what: Geographical, climate, and trait data of the Vataireoid legumes — vatsData
title: Geographical, climate, and trait data of the Vataireoid legumes — vatsData
text: dataset 1610 georeferenced, taxonomically vetted herbarium records Vataireoid legumes climate data (WorldClim's bioclimatic variables) extracted. dataframe-formatted dataset also includes categorical traits, example DBH, spindly, biome classification (sensu Schrire et al. 2005), probability occurrence global succulent biome (Ringelberg et al. 2019).

title: Geographical, climate, and trait data of the Vataireoid legumes — vatsData
code: data(vatsData)

title: Geographical, climate, and trait data of the Vataireoid legumes — vatsData
text: Table .csv format

what: BEAST-dated phylogeny of the Vataireoid legumes — vatsTree
title: BEAST-dated phylogeny of the Vataireoid legumes — vatsTree
text: dated phylogeny Vataireoid legumes comprehensive BEAST analysis nine genes (nuclear ribosomal ETS , plastid regions matK, 3′-trnK intron, psbA-trnH, trnL intron, rps16 intron, trnQ-5′rps16, trnD-trnT).

title: BEAST-dated phylogeny of the Vataireoid legumes — vatsTree
code: data(vatsTree)

title: BEAST-dated phylogeny of the Vataireoid legumes — vatsTree
text: Treedata file nexus format resulting BEAST analysis

title: BEAST-dated phylogeny of the Vataireoid legumes — vatsTree
text: Cruz et al. (2018)
